channel.title: Server IP Log
channel.description:
so im working on my server and i want to write a system that logs the players IP in a .txt file. then the player logs in, and it takes the top one on the list and makes it the 'last logged in ip' on the player (.txt) file. I tried this twice, i cant get it to work correctly....
After that i want it to have an 'if else' basically checking if the last ip is the same as the current ip. if its the same say something like "welcome back + name" or if its not, say "Warning: this isnt the same IP you last logged in from" Hopfully this will warn players of hackers and such.
so, any ideas as to how id write something like this?

item.title: Server IP Log
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:3, topic:432386”] try { final BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./data/connections.txt", true)); try { out.write("IP: " + player.socketChannel.socket().getInetAddress().getHostAddress()); out.newLine(); } finally { out.close(); } } catch (final IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }[/quote]

Thx man. ill build off of this.

[quote=“ImmensePK, post:2, topic:432386”]not a good idea tbh, imagine newbehs with dynamic IP addresses, they will be logging in and see’ing the warning then saying “OMFGZZ I BEENZ HAXEDZO0RZ! im missing full torva and phat set” etc etc…

just a pre-warning

lol[/quote]

i didnt think of that…lol maby ill just make a “you last logged in at + IP” like the real RS

Read full topic

item.title: Server IP Log
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

try { final BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./data/connections.txt", true)); try { out.write("IP: " + player.socketChannel.socket().getInetAddress().getHostAddress()); out.newLine(); } finally { out.close(); } } catch (final IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
